file_content.text: [The terminal is silent.]
[The terminal is a painstaking reconstruction of the ancient terminal on Coruscant.]
[But when you touch the familiar controls, nothing happens.]
The order needs your guidance once more, Masters.
Please don't be broken.
Do you recognize me?
Hello?
I can't waste time here while the Republic is in need.
This is pointless.
A broken vessel merely frees its contents.
Your face is familiar.
Though life has written on you, since we taught you the shielding technique.
Yes, now I recall. Hmph, I sense the Sith were behind our sudden plunge into darkness.
A moment, Master Arca. Was the shielding technique successful? Did it save your Master?
Unfortunately, the evil influencing her was too powerful.
Yuon is dead.
I'm sorry for dwelling on a painful subject. Please, tell us what brought you back to us....
Yuon Par is alive and well because of the lessons you taught me.
Yes, thank you.
That is most excellent news. Now, tell us what brought you here....
Masters, war with the Empire has broken out once more, and the entire Republic is threatened....
That's not why I'm here.
The Empire will crush the Republic if you can't give me some way to defend it....
I'm in a hurry.
So, you seek an army to protect the Republic from its enemies?
Quite a puzzle, even for us.
But not impossible, Master Tharis. The ancient Rakata boast in their writings of imprisoning a "sleeping army."
As I remember, the Rakata conquered and enslaved most of the galaxy before they died out.
I know of the Rakata.
Go on....
Unless it was a droid battalion, anything the Rakata imprisoned would have died millennia ago.
It'll be a dead army by now.
The translation--oh, this is fascinating. Apparently, the Rakata imprisoned this army in stasis beneath a planet's surface.
But, see, the writings are incomplete. There's no record of which planet it is.
Perhaps we could extrapolate the planet's position from the rest of the writings.
Any star charts? Landmarks?
They speak of a fading nova in the night sky, during the prison's construction....
In that time period? Then it's somewhere in the Mid Rim. But we're missing a coordinate to pinpoint it.
See here. "A monument proclaims our victory..." And that's the Rakata term for Hoth. This monument on Hoth will have the last coordinate.
So we find another way.
Great, a dead end.
Don't lose hope. The Rakata often recorded their empire's achievements in detail.
Yes, see. "A monument proclaims our victory..." And there, the Rakata term for Hoth.
If the monument remains on Hoth, it may guide you to this sleeping army.
But go carefully. The Rakata protected their monuments, from enemies and rebelling slaves. Its guardians may still be active.
I feel like there's so much more you could teach me.
I wish I could stay.
I appreciate your help.
I'm not afraid.
You've done a great service in reawakening us.
For now, we must conserve our energy. And you have an army to find.
May the Force be with you, and with the Republic.
